item.title: I'm doing HTS's Programming 2 but
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[size=4]EDIT: This is no longer a problem, I realised I had just enough time to save the file and run the program.[/size]

I’ve come along a slight problem. “This level is about image analyzing.”.

Everytime I load the page the image I am supposed to be analyzing changes. So, I thought no problem, I’ll just parse the image using the ImageIO.read(URL) method instead of ImageIO.load(File) method. Although, when I try and run this program, I get nothing back, I’ve even tryed using the Scanner class to read the URL and I still get nothing.

    public static void readURL() {
        try {
            URL myURL = new URL("http://www.hackthissite.org/missions/prog/2/PNG/");
            Scanner myScan = new Scanner(myURL.openStream());
            System.out.println(myScan.nextLine());
        } catch (MalformedURLException ex) {
            Logger.getLogger(Main.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
        } catch (IOException ex) {
            Logger.getLogger(Main.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
        }
    }

returns “java.util.NoSuchElementException: No line found”.

Using this.bufferedImage = ImageIO.read(new URL("http://www.hackthissite.org/missions/prog/2/PNG/index.php"));
returns “NullPointerException” when I try to use bufferedImage.getHeight(); or width, or anything really.

Could anyone point me in the right direction? Thank you.

Oh, and also, it seems the image is created using PHP.

Read full topic
